qas.question: In what year did the Nazi's alter around one-third of the toponyms of the area?
Around how many places were renamed when the Nazis entered Prussia?
What would happen if some didn't comply with the Nazi's with their demands?
In what year was the Protestant Reformation started?
What position did Adolf Hitler have in 1938?
In what year did Adolf Hitler rise to power?
How many Polish places were there ordered to be renamed?
How many Lithuanian places were ordered to be renamed?

context: In <a0_0><b3_0><b5_0>1938<b5_0/><b3_0/><a0_0/> the Nazis altered about one-third of the toponyms of the area, eliminating, Germanizing, or simplifying a number of Old Prussian names, as well as those Polish or Lithuanian names originating from colonists and refugees to Prussia during and after the Protestant Reformation. More than <a1_0><b6_0><b7_0>1,500<b7_0/><b6_0/><a1_0/> places were ordered to be renamed by 16 July 1938 following a decree issued by Gauleiter and <b4_0>Oberpräsident<b4_0/> Erich Koch and initiated by Adolf Hitler. Many who would not cooperate with the rulers of Nazi Germany were <a2_0>sent to concentration camps<a2_0/> and held prisoner there until their death or liberation.
